result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Jacoby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On 11/14/14 Court amends JOC to reflect 0 days sentence credit on this case.
Consecutive to: Any other time being served

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

AODA assessment and any follow-up counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Absolute sobriety.
No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.
Random urine screens and breath tests.
No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community.
Cooperate with all rules set forth by the Department.
No new violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim, Sharon Cutwell Company Inc.
Obtain/Maintain full time employment or full time school with part-time employment.
Mental health assessment and any follow-up counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Take all prescribed medications.
Submit to DNA sample; surcharge waived.
Pay all supervision fees.

To be paid jointly & severally with co-actors.  

Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked of will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Clerk:  C. Toms / Reporter:  Diana Hausman.   
State by ADA Megan Carmody.  Defendant in custody and by Atty Sargent.

Reporter:  F. O'Claire.  Clerk:  D.S.  State by ADA Megan Carmody.  Defendant in custody & by Atty Stephen Sargent.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant files waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court examines defendant and accepts waiver and binds matter over for trial.  State files the information.  Counsel advises appearing as Special Prosecutor to this case, but that Ozaukee County retains jurisdiction.  Defense has no objection.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the information and enters a not guilty plea. Defense files plea questionnaire.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court advises the defendant of firearms and voting restrictions.  Court further orders a presentence investigation and orders matter adj to 9/30 at 8:30 am for sentencing.  On State's motion, Court orders defendant remanded into custody.
Case not called on record.  Court unable to proceed due to no copy of the criminal complaint.  Parties requesting to hold initial appr / prelim hrg / plea/sentencing at next date of 7/15 at 1:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: State by DA Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  State advises Special Prosecutor will be appointed.  Court will recuse and matter will be sent out of county.  Court sets bail at $5000 cash w/conditions:  Absolute sobriety; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Parties will be notified of next appearance date.
